content: Many workplaces in Los Angeles County have implemented various safety protocols to minimize the risk of COVID-19 transmission among workers. Some common safety measures include requiring masks to be worn, limiting the number of people allowed in common areas such as break rooms, increasing the frequency of cleaning and disinfecting, and screening employees for symptoms of COVID-19. Some employers have also implemented staggered work schedules or alternating in-office and remote work days to reduce the number of people in the office at any given time. These safety protocols have been put in place to create a safer working environment for all employees as the pandemic continues.
